title: How to Strip Turf

steps.headline: Cut the turf.
steps.description: Use a lawnmower to cut the turf as short as possible.

steps.headline: Cover the turf.
steps.description: Lay corrugated cardboard, or between 6 and 8 layers of newspaper, over the turf to be stripped. Ensure that there is no colored ink on the newspaper or cardboard. Cover the newspaper or cardboard with 3 inches (7.6 cm) of mulch, wood chips, compost or grass clippings.

steps.headline: Leave the turf.
steps.description: Allow the covered turf to sit for 2 months.

steps.headline: Plant the garden.
steps.description: Dig holes directly through the newspaper or cardboard and insert your plants. Newspaper and cardboard will decompose into the ground.

steps.headline: Select an herbicide made to kill grasses.
steps.description: Choose a product that decomposes rapidly.

steps.headline: Apply the herbicide.
steps.description: Follow the directions that accompany the product. Spray the herbicide over all grass and weeds. Refrain from applying the herbicide to any plants you wish to keep.

steps.headline: Let the turf rest.
steps.description: Allow the treated area of turf to sit for 4 weeks. If living turf remains after 4 weeks, reapply the herbicide. Wait 1 more week.

steps.headline: Till the soil.
steps.description: Use a tiller to prepare the ground for planting.

steps.headline: Cut the turf.
steps.description: Use a lawnmower to cut the turf as short as possible.

steps.headline: Cover the turf.
steps.description: Place a clear plastic sheet over the turf that you want to remove. Place bricks or other heavy objects around the edges of the plastic to secure it.

steps.headline: Leave the plastic.
steps.description: Allow the plastic to lie over the turf for 2 months.

steps.headline: Remove the plastic.
steps.description: The ground should be ready for planting.

steps.headline: Water the turf.
steps.description: Water the turf a few days before you plan to dig it up. Water the turf enough so that it is moist, but not waterlogged.

steps.headline: Divide the turf into sections.
steps.description: Use a spade or edger to cut strips into the turf. Use a sod cutter for large lawns. Cut the strips 1 foot (.3 m) wide and 2 inches (5 cm) deep. Cut each of the strips into shorter sections between 1 and 2 feet (.3 m and .6 m) in length.

steps.headline: Remove the turf.
steps.description: Insert a pitchfork or spade underneath a strip of turf. Pull the strip up and out of the ground to extract it. Ensure that you keep the roots of the turf intact in the section that you remove. Remove all of the divided strips.

steps.headline: Till the ground.
steps.description: Use a tiller to break up the soil for planting.
